docblock.description: Represents the main application page of the work-journal application.
docblock.long-description: This page is meant to serve as the browser's interface to the journalpage controller.

docblock.long-description: This page is meant to serve as the browser's interface to the write controller.

docblock.description: Necessary for adding more detailed error reports.
Abstract Factory for maintaining the MVC relationships.
docblock.long-description: ControllerFactory is the base class of the other controllers. Each controller must have a model, a view, and a helper utility class. The models and views are dynamically created at runtime based on the type of controller. The controller's has 3 roles: 1. Get information from $_POST 2. Decide what course of action to take 3. Tell the browser, model, or view what to do
The View represents the part of the MVC that displays the Model to the user. It grabs relevant variables from the Model.
The Model represents all the logic of the application, as well as connections to the persistent data stores.

docblock.description: The constructor dynamically constructs the appropriate views and models as well as the utility object.
All constructors must respond to user actions and perform the approriate operations.

docblock.description: Include the base class of the JournalPageController class.
Include the view of the JournalPageController class.
Include the model of the JournalPageController class.

docblock.long-description: JournalPageController reads the $_POST superglobal, makes decisions on what to do, and delegates tasks to the JournalPageModel and JournalPageView.

docblock.description: Makes decisions based on $_POST variables, and calls class functions to perform the appropriate action.
docblock.long-description: On the journal page, the user can: 1. save their data 2. go to the next day's entry 3. go to the previous day's entry 4. sign out

docblock.description: Go to the next day's entry.
Go to the sign in page.

docblock.description: Makes decisions based on $_POST variables, and calls class functions to perform the appropriate action.
docblock.long-description: On the read page, the user can: 1. sign out 2. go the write page 3. go the templates page 4. read today's entry 5. read all the entries this week 6. read all the entries this month 7. read all the entries this semester

docblock.description: Show all the entries this week.
